name: Army of Pixels
description: Pixel strategy that combines real-time and turn-based gameplay. 17 factions from vampire queens to mechanical golems.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Memory: 2 GB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 100 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Memory: 2 GB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 100 MB available space

reviews.review_text: An extremely fun take on a Plants vs. Zombies style row-shooter. More fast-paced, kenetic and lighter in content than PvZ, but still fun. Can't miss for the price.

This is a pretty fun 'casual strategy', not much depth, but fun while it lasts. Definitely worth the money. Pro: - Many factions and spells (some weird ones too, like slimes and insects) - Quite unique gameplay (army placement simulator? :D ) - only 5 usd  Con: - It really needs some kind of a story or progress, all your progress is just unlocking new factions and territories - Some units are quite similar and not perfectly balanced - Pixel graphics are overused nowadays

Great, cute little game not pretending to be anything else. Now PROS and CONS:  CONS: - no into and/or story to the game - no outro either... - ...so u dont know what your armies ;) are fighting for etc. - saving in the game would be ok I guess  PROS: - great fun! - little, small, cute, but also very satisfing! - great visuals (at least for pixel art lovers) - great mechanics (a bit like Plants vs Zombies, but also bit different, which is OK) - nice concepts of the ememies/own minions - you have to try, and think a bit, and try... which is good enough - only two guys made this; great job!  VERDICT:  Such a little, cute game took me about 8 hours or so. There are many huge titles of which I forget about hour or two... Recommended!  PS.
